meanings.sent1: The kind lady will render assistance to those in need.
meanings.sent2: Please render your opinion on the matter at hand.
meanings.sent3: The generous donation will render much help to the charity.
meanings.sent4: Her smile can render comfort to even the most troubled hearts.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter's quick response will render safety to the trapped family.

meanings.definition: To cause to be or become
meanings.sent1: The storm will render the road impassable with fallen trees.
meanings.sent2: His hard work will render him successful in his endeavors.
meanings.sent3: The magic potion accidentally rendered the cat invisible.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected news rendered her speechless with shock.
meanings.sent5: The beautiful melody can render a peaceful atmosphere in the room.

meanings.sent1: The artist will render the landscape with great detail.
meanings.sent2: The graphic designer will render the logo in different colors.
meanings.sent3: The cartoon character was rendered in a funny pose.
meanings.sent4: The sunset rendered the sky in shades of pink and orange.
meanings.sent5: The architect's drawing can render the building's design accurately.

meanings.definition: To melt down fat to obtain drippings
meanings.sent1: The chef will render the fat to make a flavorful sauce.
meanings.sent2: Please render the bacon fat for cooking the vegetables.
meanings.sent3: The recipe requires you to render the chicken fat for the gravy.
meanings.sent4: The process of rendering the fat will take some time.
meanings.sent5: The kitchen smelled delicious as she began to render the fat.

meanings.definition: To submit or present for consideration
meanings.sent1: Please render your report to the supervisor by Friday.
meanings.sent2: He will render his findings to the committee for review.
meanings.sent3: The student will render the project proposal for evaluation.
meanings.sent4: The lawyer will render the evidence in court tomorrow.
meanings.sent5: The team will render their ideas for the new marketing campaign.
